intro: Mischogyne congensis, commonly known as the Congo mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to central Africa. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and typically grows on the branches of host trees such as Ficus species. The plant has small, leathery leaves and produces white or yellowish flowers that are pollinated by insects. Its berries are usually red or orange and contain seeds that are dispersed by birds. Mischogyne congensis plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its habitat by influencing host tree health and providing food for various wildlife species.
